DataElement.preferredName: Personal Medical History Total Pregnancy Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Value to describe the number of total pregnancies experienced.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both._Reproduction is the creation of one thing as a copy of, product of, or replacement for a similar thing.  It is commonly used in the context of biological reproduction and sex. (from Wikipedia)_Characteristics; distinguishing qualities of a person, object, or substance._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete._The condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body, after union of an ovum and spermatozoon. (Dorland, 27th ed)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both.:The generation of offspring by living organisms.:The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

Concepts.definition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both.
The generation of offspring by living organisms.
The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:The condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body, after union of an ovum and spermatozoon. (Dorland, 27th ed)

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
The state or condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body (uterus), after union of an ovum and spermatozoon, during the period from conception to birth.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the patient's ability to conceive or nurse offspring and/or their current reproductive status.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.

Concepts.definition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the patient's ability to conceive or nurse offspring and/or their current reproductive status.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.
The state or condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body (uterus), after union of an ovum and spermatozoon, during the period from conception to birth.
Determining the number or amount of something.
